conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph.
The velocity-time graph shows the velocity of the skydiver as a function of time.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration.
The graph shows that the velocity increases from 0 m/s at t = 0 s to 20 m/s at t = 10 s.
The slope of the graph is positive during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, indicating that the velocity is increasing.
Since the velocity is increasing, the acceleration must be in the same direction as the velocity.
In this case, the velocity is positive (upward), so the acceleration must also be positive (upward).
The direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is upward.
